thread.title: Will Juan Uribe be on the Mets' World Series roster?
thread.title_full: Will Juan Uribe be on the Mets' World Series roster?

author: Maria Guardado | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Will Juan Uribe be on the Mets' World Series roster?
text:
Comments 
NEW YORK â€” Injured infielder Juan Uribe attended the Mets ' voluntary workout at Citi Field on Friday afternoon and participated in baseball activities, including hitting and taking some ground balls. 
Uribe was sidelined for the first two rounds of the playoffs after suffering a chest contusion while making a diving play during the Subway Series in September. He hasn't played in a major league game since Sept. 25 at Cincinnati, when he reaggravated the injury. 
Uribe said he feels "good" and is "trying" to be ready in time for the World Series, which begins on Tuesday, Oct. 27. 
When asked if Uribe could potentially make the Mets' World Series roster, manager Terry Collins said, "I don't know." 
PLUS : Why Mets' Yoenis Cespedes missed Friday's workout 
While Uribe could offer a dangerous right-handed bat off the bench, Collins pointed out that the Kansas City Royals, one of the Mets' potential World Series opponents , have no left-handed starters in their rotation. Furthermore, Uribe hasn't played in nearly a month. 
Uribe's injury opened up a spot on the Mets' postseason roster for outfielder Kirk Nieuwenhuis, who bats left-handed and is 0-for-2 in two playoff at-bats. 
Uribe, 36, is one of the few members on the team with World Series experience, as he won two rings with the Chicago White Sox and the San Francisco Giants.
